page.title: 11Transport in Marsworth
page.content: { CANAL}Water is supplied from Tring Railway Cutting and three reservoirs which are also Nature reserves.Narrow boats,now used for pleasure cruising were originally major coal carriers Birmingham/London.Marsworth has the Aylesbury Arm junction and a canal maintenance yard,with lock gate manufacture at Bulbourne. {RAIL}The main line to Scotland takes commuters through Stephenson's Tring cutting to London.Equidistant Stations at Tring and Cheddington have daytime hourly services_more at peak times.Cheap day tickets take shoppers to London or Milton Keynes.{ROAD}Heavy lorries use the A505/A45 Luton/Cambridge/Ipswich road.The Celtic Upper Ickenield Way salt trail nowB488/9 are parallel roads joining the A41 at Tring to the Dunstable Road.Most local people have a car/cars for daily work/shopping.
